name: strawberry seedling production, in unheated greenhouse, for planting | strawberry seedling, for planting | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15531/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 strawberry seedling, under non-heated greenhouse.;Functional unit is one strawberry seedling at nursery.;50000 seedlings per ha.year are considered.

This activity starts with the nursery producing seedlings

Included processes: peat moss use, end-of-life and distribution to seedling farm, irrigation and greenhouse infrastructure.
Not included are: fertilizers and pesticides application and transport from the nursery to the farm where the seedlings will be planted. 
This activity ends with seedlings exiting the nursery.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/013:Plant propagation/0130:Plant propagation

processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data are based on the main production of strawberry seedlings in the United States. Technology: Plastic greenhouses, non-heated
For the transport of seedlings to strawberry farm, 100 g per seedling is considered, including moisture and container (Stoessel et al. 2012).

exchanges.description: Calculated value: 50000 seedlings per ha, transplanted after 2 weeks (i.e. 1/26 of a year)

Mass of peat for one seedling: 30 g/ seedling (Based on Stoessel et al. 2012); 2.3 seedling/m2 (Martinez-Blanco et al. 2011)

exchanges.description: Water, to water, river = 0.2*((ETirr/EFirr) â€' ETirr), based on LÃ©vovÃ¡ et al. (2012); Irrigation efficiency: 63%, based on FAO (1989)
Calculated value: 1 ha divided by 50000 seedlings per ha and by 26 (i.e. seedlings are transplanted after 2 weeks). Note: greenhouse dataset stands for 1 m2 used over 1 year

exchanges.description: Literature value: total amount of water used for irrigation (Manfredi et al. 2014). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Water use for irrigation' (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Irrigation water for  assumed 2 times higher for US strawberries than for Italian tomatoes due to lower efficiency.
